alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 12:11PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Vernon Parish, southeastern Tyler, central Newton and northeastern Jasper Counties through 1245 PM CST... At 1211 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jasper to near Spurger. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Newton, Kirbyville, Call, Fred, Burkeville, Trout Creek, Farrsville, Magnolia Springs, Mt. Union, Spurger, Jamestown, Roganville, Harrisburg, Stringtown, Bleakwood, Wiergate and Evans. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
